channel.title: [PI] Flax

item.title: [PI] Flax
item.dc:creator: @Brandontan Brandontan
item.description:
@Brandontan wrote:

in object manager add an if statement
if(case 2646)
c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(-1, x of flax, y of flax, 0, 10); //flax
hope you can get the understanding of this
good luck

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Flax
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

I’m not familiar with PI, but you can do a few things. You can add Global Object Health, this will also be useful for Woodcutting. You could simply add a DeleteObject method beneath your Flax, but it won’t respawn. You can create a new DeleteObject method with a timer to respawn Objects. You might want to check your Woodcutting for ObjectHealth or something similar, if it has tree stumps, then that’s what you’re looking for. Then again, it might be using a ReplaceObject method with a timer. You could always use that to make your new DeleteObject with a timer!

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Flax
item.dc:creator: @Nookumdip Nookumdip
item.description:
@Nookumdip wrote:

Hello

I am adding flax to my PI server.

It looks like this so far:

	case 2646:
	c.getItems().addItem(1779, 1);
	c.startAnimation(827);
	break;

But my question is… How do you make so the object 2646 dissapears after I picked it ?
And also, how do I add a “timer” so you can’t spam click it ?

Thanks

Read full topic
